Detailed Description

Manages the computation of chemical source terms for an entire reaction mechanism.

Todo:
Currently, intermediate values are always recomputed even if they don't need to be. An detailed look should be made into how to save computations when, for instance, the temperature does not change. This also holds true for the jacobian. For example, if the source terms were just computed, there is no need to recompute the reaction rate coefficients in the jacobian evaluation.

Definition at line 262 of file Kinetics.cpp.

◆ forwardRateCoefficients()

void forwardRateCoefficients ( double *const  p_kf)

Fills the vector keq with the equilibrium constant for each reaction \( K_{C,j} = \left(\frac{P_{atm}}{R_u T}\right)^{\Delta \nu_j} \exp\left(-\frac{\Delta {G^\circ}_j}{R_u T}\right) \).

Parameters
Tthe temperature in K
keqon return, \( K_{C,j}(T) \) Fills the vector kf with the forward rate coefficients \( k_{f,j} \) for each reaction. The coefficients are computed based on the rate laws assigned to each individual reaction.
kfon return, \( k_{f,j} \)

Definition at line 170 of file Kinetics.cpp.

◆ jacobianRho()

void jacobianRho ( double *const  p_jac)

Fills the matrix p_jac with the species production rate jacobian matrix.

\[ J_{ij} = \frac{\partial \dot{\omega}_i}{\partial \rho_j} \]

The Jacobian matrix should be sized to be at least the square of the number of species, ns. Access the jacobian using row-major ordering (ie: J_{ij} = p_jac[i*ns + j]).

Parameters
p_jac- on return, the jacobian matrix \(J_{ij}\)

Definition at line 370 of file Kinetics.cpp.

◆ netProductionRates()

void netProductionRates ( double *const  p_wdot)

Fills the vector wdot with the net species production rates due to the chemical reactions.

\[ \dot{\omega}_i = M_{w,i} \sum_j \left( \nu_{ij}^" - \nu_{ij}^{'} \right) \left[ k_{f,j} \prod_i C_i^{\nu_{ij}^{'}} - k_{b,j} \prod_i C_i^{\nu_{ij}^"} \right] \Theta_{TB} \]

Parameters
p_wdot- on return, the species production rates in kg/m^3-s
